{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3071486,"name":"","username":"sxpN24","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/94ad74/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-07-04T09:54:12.838Z","cooked":"

PDP disconnects while testing my code on Robot.

  • Robot run with 11.3V
  • Victor’s set 0.5
  • Dont using VRM
  • No problems with CAN cables
  • Comm comes back 1 minute after disconnection

PDP, Wifi, Roborio, CAN cables changed, problem persists.

Before the comm error PDP blinking yellow.

Please help me in any way.

ROBOT VIDEO:
→ video

My guess is you have an unhandled exception in your code. Check your driver station log and console for an error.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2022-07-04T14:00:04.357Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":99,"readers_count":98,"score":24.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":413201,"topic_slug":"pdp-no-communication-in-a-moving","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":38557,"username":"Bmongar","name":"Brad","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bmongar/{size}/228654_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53402,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/pdp-no-communication-in-a-moving/413201/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3071499,"name":"Ryan Blue","username":"Ryan_Blue","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ryan_blue/{size}/174016_2.png","created_at":"2022-07-04T14:11:22.389Z","cooked":"

How is the radio powered? The radio needs a constant 12v supply and a drivetrain will drop the battery voltage below 12v on startup. The radio should be powered through a VRM or RPM.

Posting the driver station log files will help others help you to isolate the problem.

11.3 V seems a little low for a robot. We normally run 12.5-13, maybe low 12s if we have to

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2022-07-04T17:51:42.867Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":82,"readers_count":81,"score":36.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":413201,"topic_slug":"pdp-no-communication-in-a-moving","display_username":"Brendan Conover","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52398,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"washed alum|frcdesign.org"},"post_url":"/t/pdp-no-communication-in-a-moving/413201/5","custom_user_title":"washed alum|frcdesign.org","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3071521,"name":"Jimmy Mish","username":"jimbo493","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jimbo493/{size}/7047_2.png","created_at":"2022-07-04T18:06:34.936Z","cooked":"

Whenever I see a lost connection around one minute is it almost always a radio reboot. You said you aren’t using a VRM, your radio should be powered from one since it will provide regulated 12v to the radio.

11.4 volts does also seem low at idle for a robot. You may need to retire that battery.
